title: Southampton hope to avoid Manchester City thrashing to avoid most conceded in three games record
text:
It's been a miserable few days for Southampton but it could get a lot worse when they visit Manchester City this weekend in the Premier League.

The Saints travel to the Etihad Stadium for the second time in five days desperate to regain some form.

Ralph Hasenhuttl's hapless side have already lost once at the champions this week going down 3-1 in the Carabao Cup on Tuesday.

Southampton have already lost 3-1 at Manchester City in the Carabao Cup once this week and head back to the Etihad Stadium for a Premier League encounter on Saturday

After being beaten 9-0 at home by Leicester City on Friday, the Saints will now hope to avoid letting three in again to avoid the record of most goals goals conceded across three matches

It followed up a miserable Friday night where they were humiliated on home soil by Leicester City and crashed to a joint record 9-0 defeat.

But now the Saints are in danger of matching another unwanted record when they visit Pep Guardiola's side again.

Should their net be breached three times again they would equal a record of conceding the most goals over three games during one season, which currently stands at 15.

Ipswich set the record in 1995, with Manchester United doing most of the damage in a 9-0 win

RECORDS FOR SAINTS TO AVOID Mar 4, 1995: Man Utd 9-0 Ipswich Mar 8, 1995: Tottenham 3-0 Ipswich Mar 20, 1995: Norwich 3-0 Ipswich Total conceded: 15 goals Dec 23, 2012: Chelsea 8-0 Villa Dec 26, 2012: Villa 0-4 Tottenham Dec 29, 2012: Villa 0-3 Wigan Total conceded: 15 goals

It's not looking hopeful for the Saints either, who have conceded the most goals of any side in the Premier League with 25. To make matter worse, Manchester City have scored the most and are averaging over three goals a game this term.

The existing record was first set by Ipswich Town in 1995 when the already doomed to relegation Tractor Boys were breached 15 times in defeats at Manchester United, Tottenham Hotspur and Norwich City.

Aston Villa then matched the record 17 years later when they suffered a miserable Christmas thanks to thrashings by Chelsea, Tottenham and Wigan.

But Aston Villa equalled the record in 2012 with a run that started with an 8-0 loss at Chelsea

That was followed up by a Gareth Bale hat-trick as Spurs triumphed 4-0 at Villa on Boxing Day

Despite Paul Lambert's side awful run - his side managed to improve and see off relegation

The Latics actually hold the unwanted accolade of conceding the most goals across three games but their run was across two campaigns.

Opposition teams struck 18 times in the space of three hours of football, with Chelsea putting eight past them on the final day of the 2009-10 season.

That was then followed up with Roberto Martinez's team losing 4-0 at home to newly promoted Blackpool on the opening weekend of the 2010-11 season and again against Chelsea who fired in six without reply at the DW Stadium.
description: It's been a miserable few days for Southampton but it could get worse when they visit Manchester City for the second time in a week as they look to avoid matching another unwanted record.
